meta_description: One of New Mexico’s most popular museums opened to the public in 1953 and has gained national and international recognition as home to the world’s largest collection of folk art. The museum is open, and ready to welcome you for your 1st visit or your 100th! Please Explore Our Online Museum Experiences!
hours_text:
###  [Hours & Admission __](visit/hours-admission.html)

##### OPEN:

Daily 10am-5pm  
  
Winter Hours:   
CLOSED MONDAYS November through April.  
  
Closed Thanksgiving Day, December 25th, January 1st. 

##### ADMISSIONS:

Adult: $7 For New Mexico Residents, $12 for Non-Residents  
16 Under and Members: Free [Learn More](visit/hours-admission.html)

###  [Online Experiences __](visit/online.html)

[](visit/online.html)

###  [Tours __](visit/tours.html)

[](visit/tours.html)

MOIFA is open. We look forward to your visit! Call for current walk-in tour times and days. Schedule your guided tour for groups or school groups.

Accessibility __

The Museum of International Folk Art is committed to the accessibility of our museum’s facility, programs, services, and events, including our website and online programs. As our staff works to implement improved accessibility, please continue to check this page for updated information. 

## CONTACT US

To request an accommodation, please contact 505-476-1204 (voice) or [accessibility@dca.nm.gov](mailto:moifa.accessibility@dca.nm.gov "mailto:moifa.accessibility@dca.nm.gov") (email) in advance of your visit. 

For additional information or to share your questions, concerns, and feedback, please contact 505-476-1204 (voice) or [accessibility@dca.nm.gov](/accessibility@dca.nm.gov) (email).

## ASL INTERPRETATION

We provide ASL interpretation for most of our public programs, please visit our [Events](https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.internationalfolkart.org%2Fevents%2F&data=05%7C02%7CKemely.Gomez%40dca.nm.gov%7Caafe762755c44...
